      • checkNFC

        private void checkNFC()
        Check if a NFC adapter is available and/or activated. This method checks if a NFC adapter is available on the used Phone and if so if it is enabled. If no adapter is available the app will show a message and than close itself. If an adapter is available but not enabled the app will suggest to open the settings to activate it. If not activated the app will close itself.

      • onPause

      • onNewIntent

        protected void onNewIntent(android.content.Intent intent)
        Overrides:
        onNewIntent in class android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity

      • doProcess

        private void doProcess(android.content.Intent intent)
        This method checks and send the chosen command. This method is called from the onNewIntent method of the activity and initializes the tag, writer and reader attribute. Depending on the tab on which the user clicks on a button the method will use the methods of the respective fragment class. If the user is on the SendText tab the app will ask if the command should be send or not.

      • sendData

        protected void sendData(boolean b,
            android.nfc.Tag tag)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        android.nfc.FormatException
        This method simply processes the command sending only from the SendTextFragment. First either the highspeed on or off command will be send. And after that depending on the given boolean parameter it will send the command or not.
        Parameters:
        b - true if the command should be send.
        tag - the NFC tag from the intent
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        android.nfc.FormatException
